sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Human Trafficking Task Force Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Human Trafficking Task Force Act.

sections.heading: Findings. The General Assembly finds the following:
sections.text: Findings. The General Assembly finds the following:

sections.heading: Administrative support. The Department of Children and Family Services shall provide administrative and other support to the Human Trafficking Task Force
sections.text: Administrative support. The Department of Children and Family Services shall provide administrative and other support to the Human Trafficking Task Force.

sections.heading: Duties of Human Trafficking Task Force
sections.text: The Human Trafficking Task Force shall conduct a study on the human trafficking problem in this State and shall hold hearings in furtherance of:

sections.heading: Report. On or before June 30, 2024, the Human Trafficking Task Force shall report its findings and recommendations to the General Assembly, by filing copies of its report as provided in Section 3
sections.text: 1 of the General Assembly Organization Act, and to the Governor.

sections.heading: Task force abolished; Act repealed. The Human Trafficking Task Force is abolished and this Act is repealed on July 1, 2025.
sections.text: Task force abolished; Act repealed. The Human Trafficking Task Force is abolished and this Act is repealed on July 1, 2025.

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
sections.text: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
